newsitem.title: ITALY: Pompeii, Uffizi are top Italian historic sites.
newsitem.headline: Pompeii, Uffizi are top Italian historic sites.

text.p: Italy's top 20 state-run museums and archaelogical sites drew in more than 11.4 million paying visitors last year with the Roman ruins at Pompeii and the Uffizi Gallery in Florence pulling the biggest crowds.
The Culture Ministry said on Saturday the total number of visitors to the 20 sites was 6.25 percent up on 1995.
The ruins at Pompeii, buried by a sea of molten lava and ash when Mount Vesuvius erupted in AD 79., attracted 1.9 million visitors, more than 100,000 more than in 1995.
The Uffizi Gallery, home to some of the greatest works of Renaissance art, was damaged in a bomb attack in 1993 which investigators have blamed on the Mafia.
More than 1.1 million people toured its rooms last year, up 10 percent on 1995.
